intro: Rapanea katrikouensis, commonly known as the Katrikouen rapanea, is a rare shrub native to the island of Katrikou in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with leathery, elliptical leaves that have a distinct aromatic scent. It produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by dark, glossy berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
